comments: Not kind to her students, however she does want everybody to learn, she just doesn\'t explain anything well and refuses to answer some questions because "we\'ve done this a thousand times". Come to class, or you will most likely fail. I never missed a class and still found myself scrambling to teach myself many subjects.

comments: DONT OPEN YOUR BOOK, youll never use it, also if youve never taken a chemistry class before, pick a different processor. If you do take her, be ready to answer questions because she wont move on until you do. Also, review on your own because her review is basically her having you ask questions and then moving on.

comments: I highly recommend avoiding her at all costs. The class itself isn\'t all too difficult, if you show up and do what you are told you should break above a C. That being said, she is extremely rude. Also she actually went back and helped SOME students improve on exams that they bombed, and denied help of any kind to others, against policy. BEWARE.

comments: I read the reviews of Dr. Chaudhuri before taking her class was reluctant but i\'m really glad I took chem with her. She is super knowledge in chem, she lectures heavy and the whole semester was based on 4 tests but I got an A on them all. Just show up, pay attention, and study and you\'ll be ok. She also gives out studyguides very similar to tests.

comments: I was warned about taking this teacher but it turned out to be fine. I never missed a class, studied very hard and received an A. You\'ll get out of the class what you put into it.

comments: Dr. Urmila bases the entire grade off of 4 tests. If you do the reviews, she yells at you for not using your notes. If you use your notes, things on the tests are so different it doesn\'t even matter. She spends most of the class degrading the students for not knowing the information.

comments: Does not take her time to go over material flies through and does not explain very well will make you feel dumb if you ask questions out loud during class. The book is not needed it does not match up to the material she goes over in class. The only helpful thing she does is give review sheets out for the test an thats the only reason im doing ok

stu_tags: SKIP CLASS? YOU WON\'T PASS.  LECTURE HEAVY  CARING
comments: I think she is a tough love kind of person. She wants you to do well, but come off kind of mean. She gives you everything you need to pass. Just study and you\'ll do fine. She makes you work for it, but that doesn\'t make her a bad teacher. Also I got use to the accent after a couple days.

tag_professor: Skip class? You won\'t pass. (11)  LECTURE HEAVY (5)  Tough Grader (4)  TEST HEAVY (2)  Caring (2)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (2)  Gives good feedback (1)  EXTRA CREDIT (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)
comments: I had only taken chemistry at a college level during my junior year of high school and I loved it! This professor made my hate chemistry. She went way too fast and was very monotone with a heavy accent. I ended up having to teach myself. It is helpful she provides the notes, if not I wouldn\'t have passed. She gets mad if you ask questions.

stu_tags: SKIP CLASS? YOU WON\'T PASS.  GIVES GOOD FEEDBACK
comments: She does have an accent, but it wasn\'t hard to understand. Make sure you pay attention and take notes. She gives reviews and goes over it and gives the answers. The reviews are exactly like the test! Taking notes and doing the reviews is the key to passing. The class wasn\'t easy, since it\'s chemistry. Just make sure to take notes and do the review!

stu_tags: CARING  EXTRA CREDIT  SKIP CLASS? YOU WON\'T PASS.
comments: Great professor. Loves and knows her subject. Will always answer your questions. She tries to help her students not to spend money on expensive books, and her lecture notes are all you need. She does reviews for every single exam, which is very helpful. And exams are very much like the questions from the reviews. I wish she was teaching O Chem!

comments: Really enjoyed her class. She loves the subject which made it very easy for me to stay interested. Yes she goes fast, and gets short when students ask the same question over and over, but it was frustrating for those of us who didn\'t need multiple reiterations. She is very demanding, but fair. If you can\'t get to office hours email, she will answer

comments: She rarely makes jokes and moves a little too quickly. Her accent is a little hard to understand at times. I studied a lot for the exams and felt confident that I knew the information and was disappointed when the exams were extremely difficult. Would not recommend.

tag_professor: Skip class? You won\'t pass. (11)  LECTURE HEAVY (5)  Tough Grader (4)  TEST HEAVY (2)  Caring (2)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (2)  Gives good feedback (1)  EXTRA CREDIT (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)
comments: She wants you to go to her office hours and ask questions, but when you do she gets mad and says "i went over this in class, where were you?" she makes you feel stupid for asking questions, and rarely ever jokes with the class to keep you interested. Very mean. i would not recommend her.

comments: She was not too friendly, but she was not usually rude. I liked to have her for the lab. She always gave clear instructions and hints. I had no problem with the accent, and she will answer questions. She did not mark off for labs that didn\'t work. Lab reports do not get easier than these!

comments: This course was hard as expected, but I didn\'t expect to be berated almost everyday about how my class as a whole was disappointing to her. Very disrespectful. comments: Made me hate a subject I absolutely loved prior to her class. She is not helpful, very hard to understand. She turns the simplest concepts into the most difficult topics in the world. She asks you to tell her when you don\'t understand, but gets mad at you and has an attitude if you tell her you don\'t understand.

tag_professor: Skip class? You won\'t pass. (11)  LECTURE HEAVY (5)  Tough Grader (4)  TEST HEAVY (2)  Caring (2)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (2)  Gives good feedback (1)  EXTRA CREDIT (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)
comments: This teacher is really nice, but her accent is very thick and hard to understand at times. For chemistry lab, she would write down the instructions on the board, tell you what results to expect, and would answer any questions. She would start class early, which wasn\'t fair to students who showed up on time. Easy class and the experiments were fun!
